review: A while back, the Fire TV stick had a deal for Prime members to get this at a good discount. I bought two.  I already own a Fire TV and my family has been using it daily since we got it.  Why get two more?  One as a gift for my mom, who has bad TV reception where she lives.  The second one because we were driving up to Portland over Christmas and I wanted something to use at the hotels on the way up and back, and also where we were staying up there (consistency with favored shows helps amuse our almost 3 year old).  Plus, I just liked the Fire TV a lot and wanted to show it off.First the good.  Very easy to use. Compares very favorably with the standard Fire TV.  No difference really except that you can't directly connect the stick to the network.  Can play games and do everything else the same.  The stick comes with a standard remote, and I went ahead and purchased the voice remote to give to my mom.  She loves it.  She's watching all sorts of shows and documentaries and old movies.  I'm actually very surprised how much she loves it.My frustration happened at the hotels.  We couldn't use it at all. There's no browser or other means to connect to a network that requires a browser type login. Given how this really is the "travel" version of the Fire TV, it's really frustrating that this isn't an available feature yet.  It says "coming soon" but that wasn't soon enough for us.I also wish there was a travel bag to bundle it together better than using the larger box.

review: Love, love, love this little device. While it may be smaller it has all of the applications plus some that I didn't expect. Such as Disney and ESPN. I have this and the Chromecast and the Chromecast has not been used and I actually don't even know where I put it. The Fire Stick is much more convenient with the remote than the chrome cast was for me. At the moment I have it plugged into my daughter's not so smart tv in her room. I use it on some nights when they behave and it takes only a couple minutes to turn on and cycle through the movies/shows to find something that we are both interested in watching/learning. The operating system is user friendly and has a simple layout so you can find what you need. I haven't played any games on it since it is in my daughters room. I like it so much I have considered getting one to plug into the back of my Xbox One even though it has all of those applications already. But anyways I would highly recommend this if you are looking for something that can access media/smart tv like applications.
